meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout, especially expressing joy or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children let out a whoop of delight when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: I heard a distant whoop of happiness coming from the playground.
meanings.sent3: The whoop of joy echoed through the park, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her whoop of excitement was like music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The whoop of joy was so loud, it could be heard from miles away.

meanings.definition: A loud, shrill sound made by a siren or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The whoop of the police siren filled the night air.
meanings.sent2: The whoop of the referee's whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent3: The whoop of the whistle startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The whoop of the siren pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The whoop of the whistle was so sharp, it made my ears ring.

meanings.definition: To make a loud cry or shout, especially expressing joy or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The fans began to whoop with joy as their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: She whooped with excitement when she won the contest.
meanings.sent3: The children whooped with glee as they ran through the sprinklers.
meanings.sent4: The crowd whooped in celebration as the fireworks lit up the sky.
meanings.sent5: He whooped with joy, unable to contain his happiness.

meanings.definition: To produce a loud, shrill sound, as a siren or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm whooped loudly, alerting everyone to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent2: The referee whooped to start the race, and the runners took off.
meanings.sent3: The kettle whooped as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent4: The wind whooped through the trees, creating an eerie sound.
meanings.sent5: The horn whooped as the ship sailed away into the distance.
